clues.text: After taking the Presidential oath in 1901 he shuffled out of Buffalo
In a 1901 book this French sci-fi author exposed the slaughter of elephants for their ivory
Robert Scott set off to explore this continent, where he named a peninsula for King Edward VII
Andrew Carnegie & this man merged their companies in 1901 to form U.S. Steel
In 1901, the year before his death, this author revisited "Erewhon"
In this 1994 film things got pretty hairy for Jack Nicholson, especially around the full moon
Lesley Ann Warren played Miss Scarlet & Christopher Lloyd was Prof. Plum in this 1985 spoof
Gwyneth Paltrow played the title matchmaker in this movie based on a Jane Austen novel
Be afraid.  Be very, very afraid of Mark Wahlberg as Reese Witherspoon's boyfriend from hell in this film
Robin Cook cooked up the story for this '78 thriller; Michael Crichton directed it
He had never held elected public office before he became the current governor
This classic TV sitcom took place in part at a Florida NASA installation
It's the interstate highway that runs from Maine to Florida
It's Florida's largest lake
Harry Truman chose this Florida island locale for his "Little White House" in 1946
A lawyer when he won in 1946, he went on to be the first African-American on the Supreme Court
Ernest E. Just won in 1915 for his work, including how these smallest units of life function in eggs
At its charter conference in 1945, Mary McLeod Bethune was a consultant for interracial affairs
1976's award went to dancer Ailey; 1977's went to this rhyming author
This 1939 winner's debut at the Met in 1955 was the first for an African-American soloist

This prophet was actually swallowed by a "great fish", not a whale
This man asked Pharaoh to let his people go
The 14th chapter of Judges reports that he killed a lion with his bare hands
King David's wise son, he built the temple
It's where you go when you throw doubles 3 times in a row

The player who is known as this pays you $200 whenever you pass Go

Landing on this square will set you back $200 or 10% of your total worth
It's the name of Jim Carrey's "Pet Detective"
He's just groovy as the actor who plays Austin Powers, baby
This "Pretty Woman" movie star recently played a movie star in "Notting Hill"
Cool it!  This muscleman played Mr. Freeze in the movie "Batman and Robin"

The Grimms said her stepsisters cut off parts of their feet so they could squeeze into her slipper
Rapunzel's was really long until a mean old witch cut it off so the prince couldn't climb up it
The wolf swallows this girl the Grimms called Little Red-Cap; most of us call her this
The Eiffel Tower is one of the dramatic landmarks in this European capital city
The countries of Uruguay & Paraguay are found on this continent
Honshu, Hokkaido, Shikoku & Kyushu are the 4 main islands making up this Asian country
The cold, mineral-rich region of Siberia is found in this country
Found at the tip of a continent, it's the country where Nelson Mandela was born
Something hard to find resembles "a needle in ____"
Hamlet sighed, "To be or not to be: that is ____"
In the book of Matthew, "Many are called, but few are ____"
The Latin "ceteris paribus" means "other things being ____"
Lincoln resolved, "government of the people, by the people, for the people, shall not ____"

rounds.text: In a July 1990 post Yisrael Radai called this 7-letter term "a word I just coined for Trojans, viruses, worms etc."
